home.section1.header: Familie √∏konomi laget p√• en morsom m√•te
home.section1.desc: Gimi har fantastiske familieegenskaper som tillater barn √• h√•ndtere sine egne penger og skaffe seg √∏konomiske superkrefter til det virkelige livet.
home.section2.body: Foreldre velger dag, sum og om det skal finnes uke- eller m√•nedspenger. F√• anbefalinger om hva som er passende sum for barnets alder og f√• varsling n√•r tiden er inne for √• betale.
home.section2.superpower: Barna tar ansvar og planlegger sin pengebruk.
home.section3.body: Foreldre oppmuntrer til sparing ved √• sette en rente p√• sparegris pengene. N√•r barnet sparer penger, blir sparegrisen gladere.
home.section3.superpower: Barna l√¶rer seg at sparing l√∏nner seg.
home.section4.body: Foreldre gir ut oppgaver som bel√∏nner barna. Oppgavene kan gjenta seg p√• spesifikke dager, krev bildebevis eller f√∏rstemann til m√∏lla.

home.quote5: ‚ÄúEn enkel m√•te √• l√¶re barna verdien av penger!‚Äù
family.section1.desc: ‚Ä¶er p√• vei til √• bli selvtenkende superhelter n√•r det kommer til familie√∏konomiare. De sparer, deler oppgaver og holder kontroll p√• uke- eller m√•nedspengene. Her kan du f√∏lge med p√• deres reise mot bedre √∏konomiledelse i familien.
family.slider1.goal: G√• p√• kinoGoing to the movies
family.section2.header: SEK har blitt spart av barn som bruker Gimi
family.section2.subtitle: Som tilsvarer
family.section3.body: For at barn skal kunne n√• sine dr√∏mmer, m√• foreldrene sette en rente som f√•r pengene til √• vokse. Det f√•r flere barn til √• n√• sine sparm√•l. Den gjennomsnittlige renten er:
family.section4.body: Hver dag gjennomf√∏rer barn oppgaver som tilf√∏rer noe i hjemmet og det skapes en bredere forst√•else for penger. Blant v√•re brukere har visse skiftet dekk p√• bilen, andre sittet barnevakt, malt garsjen, l√¶rt seg det periodiske system eller holdt seg borte fra sukker en hel ukek(!)
family.section5.body: Det er i hjemmet barn snakker og l√¶rer om penger. Gimi har samlet tips og triks til alle foreldre som √∏nsker √• morsom tid og ved samme tilfelle hjelpe sine egne barn til en bedre forst√•else for penger. Kast deg inn i Coaching for √• bli en superforelder!
training.section1.subtitle: Her gir vi deg som forelder tips og triks om hvordan du kan gi barnet ditt en bedre forst√•else for penger.
training.section1.point1.title: Snakk penger!
training.section1.point1.desc: Barn peker alltid p√• hva de vil ha. Ved √• gi og kj√∏pe saker til barn, gir du dem ingen sjanse til √• forst√• hvor penger kommer ifra eller hva som kreves av sparing for √• f√• noe man virkelig vil ha. Diskuter med barna dine hva du som forelder vil kj√∏pe til dem og hva de selve m√• betale for. Det er bare n√•r det fins en ide om hvordan du kan bruke penger de f√•r en virkelig verdi.
training.section1.point2.title: Bruk telefonen!
training.section1.point2.desc: Bruk et kredittkort p√• telefonen. Da vil barn forst√• at digitale penger ofte vil dukke opp p√• skjermen. Det er slik penger kommer til √• bli brukt i fremtiden og dette er derfor en flott m√•te √• forberede dem p√• voksenlivet.
training.section1.point3.title: Start tidlig!
training.section1.point3.desc: Den enkleste m√•ten √• l√¶re barn om penger er i tidlig alder. Men bel√∏nningen beh√∏ver ikke alltid √• inkludere penger. Foreldre kan for eksempel gi godteri til barna p√• l√∏rdagskvelden i bytte mot en ukes tannpuss. Det viktigste er √• gi barna dine muligheten til √• ta sine egne beslutninger.
training.tab1.title: Penger og beslutninger
training.tab1.header: Du kan ikke bare g√• i minibanken n√•r du er tom for penger
training.tab1.content:
Introduser og v√¶r noen barna kan stole p√• n√•r de vil ha r√•d eller tips
De fleste barn f√•r sine f√∏rste ukepenger mellom 7-10 √•r. Ukepngene er normalt sett rundt 20 kr ved den alderen. N√•r barnet blir eldre og mer voksent, kan du √∏ke lommepengene og etter en stund g√• over til m√•nedspenger. Ikke bare gi ut pengene. Det er viktig at du som forelder kommuniserer med ditt barn. Er barna forn√∏yd med sine valg og hvordan de har brukt pengene?

Matbordet er ikke feil
Snakke om penger rundt middagsbordet er ikke feil. Penger er noe morsomt og b√∏r ikke bli relatert til angst n√•r barnet vill kj√∏pe noe og det fins ingen penger.Det er derfor du b√∏r snakke om penger regelmessig og ikke bare n√•r det er tomt i lommeboken.

Negotiate with your children
Forhandlinger er viktig slik at foreldre og barn blir enige om hva pengene skal dekke fra tid til annen. Ukepenger som dekker et barns’s kj√∏p og p√• samme tid gir dem muligheten til √• spare litt penger oppfordrer vi til.’s.

N√•r der ikke fins mer penger: Si nei
N√•r dere har blitt enige om ukepnger og m√•nedspenger kan barnet ta ansvar for hva de kan kj√∏pe og hva de vil gj√∏re med sparepengene sine. Ved spesifikke tilfeller kan barn forvente √• f√• sine uke- eller m√•nedspenger. Barna vil derfor ha muligheten til √• disponere sine egne penger og ta ansvar for hva de kj√∏per. Om det blir slutt p√• penger m√• de vente p√• de neste uke- eller m√•nedspengene.

La barna dine kj√∏pe ‚Äùfeil‚Äù saker
De yngste barna kj√∏per mest godteri for ukepengene. For gutter er tv- og dataspill mest vanlig og for jenter smike og kl√¶r. Det er viktig at, om du som forelder ikke liker det som dine barn kj√∏per, m√• du uansett la barna dine f√• kj√∏pe det de vil. Barna m√• l√¶re seg √• gj√∏re rett og feil valg. Gj√∏re egne valg er hele ideen. Om du tar bort den delen, vil du hindre barnet √• l√¶re seg √• ta egne valg og f√• ta egne beslutninger.
training.tab1.person.title: √òkonom
training.tab1.person.about: Emma Persson er tidligere privat√∏konom for unga p√• Nordea Bank. Hun har lenge l√¶rt bort kunnskap om pengar og √∏konomi for hele familien. Emma Persson er tidligere privat √∏konom for unge mennesker p√• Nordea Bank. Hun har i lang tid gitt r√•d og l√¶rt videre kunnskap n√•r det kommer til penger og familie√∏konomi.
training.tab1.person.tip1: Gimi can become a platform where you can talk about dreams, savnings and possibilities. Don‚Äôt miss it!
training.tab1.person.tip2: When you buy something for the child, take that money from the child‚Äôs weekly pocket money. By doing that you show the child a clear line between your money and the child‚Äôs money.
training.tab1.person.bubble: Two out of three children in Sweden get weekly- or monthly pocket money from their parents.
training.tab2.title: Digital appliances
training.tab2.header: Apps and digital appliances give the children a good base for learning.
training.tab2.content:
Learning which is not damageable
Det finns ingen forskning som visar att det skulle vara skadligt f√∂r barn, stora som sm√•, att anv√§nda en surfplatta eller mobil. Att surfplattan eller mobilen ska s√§nda ut skadlig str√•lning eller g√∂ra att ett barn p√• n√•got s√§tt f√•r s√§mre inl√§rning √§r bara en myt. Det finns d√§remot en risk d√• vi l√•ter bli att l√§ra v√•ra barn om digitala tj√§nster och plattfomar, via mobiler och l√§splattor, vilket leder till barnen inte l√§r sig den teknik som resten av samh√§llet har anammat.

Give a chance to this new form for learning
Som f√∂r√§ldrar √§r vi ofta k√§nslostyrda och vi m√§nniskor har √∂verlag sv√•rt att relatera till nya saker i samh√§llet. Att anv√§nda digitala verktyg till barnen f√∂r att underl√§tta vardagen ses av m√•nga som skamligt. P√• samma s√§tt som vi har skepsis mot mobiler och surfplattor har vi bem√∂tt boken och tv:n n√§r de var nya i samh√§llet. Men l√•t inte dina egna ideal av barndomen styra.

Money in the phone
The easiest way for adults to keep control over the money is looking at the mobile. So this should be the same for children. Today, most children have their own mobile phones and have a good understanding for its use and functions. Therefore it is important that they also can handle money in their mobiles. Use apps that are understandable for children that show money its true value and the symbolism by saving and wasting.

Digital purchases are also purchases
It‚Äôs difficult for children to understand that mobile purchases or purchases at the internet costs money too. Because they can not see any physical money is it important that you as a parent enlightens the children that mobile- or internet purchases are bought by real money. One out of ten youths says that they have bought something at the internet that they thought was free. Every second youth has at the same time bought something from the internet within the last three months.

Let the digital accentuate creativity
Mobile phones and tablets inhibit the creativity amongst children, compared to for example Lego. This is a myth. If you take a closer look at a package from Lego, those it give you all the instructions what to do. Compare that to Minecraft for example, where there are no boundaries for what you can create with an infinite number of ‚Äùlego-pieces‚Äù. The next generation’s digital platforms will without a doubt challenge the physical worlds limitations when it comes to creativity.
training.tab2.person.title: Budget advisor
training.tab2.person.about: Bodil has for a long time worked with family economy. She has looked into how you with some new methods and tools can improve the children‚Äôs learning capability when it comes to money.
training.tab2.person.tip1: Use digital appliances to teach children about money
training.tab2.person.tip2: Download games that in a pedagogical way gives the children opportunity to handle money in a fictitious world
training.tab2.person.tip3: Let your children know that purchases like apps, music or games from the internet cost money
training.tab2.bubble1: 84 % of the children in Sweden aged between 5-8 years old have access to a tablet.
training.tab2.bubble2: 50 % of our users have bought something from the internet during the last three months.
training.tab3.title: Practice & learning
training.tab3.header: You can‚Äôt just go to a ATM if you are out of money
training.tab3.content:
Prepare your children for the grown-up life
The way you can learn mathematics, balance of your mind and football is the same way that you can learn to handle your economy. A good way to lear the children about economy is to give them the liberty to questioning and think for themselves. If we during the childrens childhood give them the opportunity to make their own choices, they will be able to achieve succesful and horrible purchases. Even the bad purchases will help the children to learn and develop when it comes to economy. Maybe they will change their descions next time? Give the children the liberty to choose for themselves.

Create the opportunity to earn an extra coin
By giving the children tasks at home and at school, they will be learning that getting money often demands some kind of effort. When the children are earning their own money, they will understand its value and a feeling of owning their own money. It can also create an companionship within the family when everybody is helping out. The children should not get paid for everything they do. They can than easily think that as soon as they do something they will be rewarded with money.

Learn and play
To play with money and play games like Monopoly is a good way to introduce new terms and create an understanding for expenditures and revenues. Buying/selling games at home gives the children an insight with concepts like money and trade. If you have any older children they can start to invest in real or fictional companies, and create a game where you compare with the real tradning market. Compete and see who succeeds ‚Äùinvesting‚Äù money in the right company!

Give a saving bonus
By giving the children an interest rate for their savings, you will increase the opportunity that they will save money. You have come a far way learning the children about moneys value if they understand that it is important to save and it will take time to achieve the amount that an expensive item costs. Let the children create their own savings goals. Let them know that saved money increases as time goes by. That is an realistic image for how the world looks today.

When the money runs out
Sit down and have a chat with your child if there is not enough money to buy certain items. Talk about why there is to little money. Does your child get to small amounts, or does he or her spend their money to easily. Unpredicted expenditures is a matter, but if you give the child the impression that they always can get more money, they will never learn the money’s true value.
training.tab3.person.title: Leg. Psychologist and leg. psychotherapist
training.tab3.person.about: Liv has long experience from working with children, youths and families. She has also given out several books within the topic and helped families around the country.
training.tab3.person.tip1: Let the children create a business at home so that they better can understand trading.
training.tab3.person.tip2: To become aware of consequences from own behaviour is educative for children and Gimi can help focus more on that subject.
training.tab3.bubble1: Encouraging the stuff you want to see more from, is the best way to affect childrens behaviour.
about.subtitle: We are here to change and improve the way young people learn how to handle digital money. We welcome all kids and parents to join our cause!
about.section1.header: Let the weekly pocket money live on!
about.section1.block1: I grew up with my parents and five siblings during the 90‚Äôs. I had 200 meters to the kiosk, a bike with 21 gears and twelve marbles. I was eight years and king every Saturday when i got my golden 10 kr coin. The golden coin wasn‚Äôt only precious and shiny, I could even trade it for my favorite ice cream and still have 6 kroners left that i could put in my piggy bank. You could say that I had superpowers.
about.section1.block2: I was pretty good at nagging at that time. Even though i  pointed at items and stuff i wanted i had to save money or wait for christmas eve. When i had saved for some time, i normally bought marbles or hockeycards for my collectorbinder. For a long time i was hoping for Mario Lemieux, a center who played for Pittsburg Penguins. When he finally popped out of a package i bought i started crying and jumping because i was so happy. My mother asked me to run to times around the house so i could calm down. Even though i have stopped running around the house i still get a smile on my face when i know that Mario is framed in my binder.
about.section1.block3: I miss my childhood. I miss Donald Duck pockets, stealing apples and buying candy for Saturday evening at the local kiosk. It‚Äôs because of this longing that I created Gimi. Because it‚Äôs different today. Many children are today not able to be kings or queens for a day or dosen‚Äôt even get any weekly pocket money at Saturdays. Sure, the ice cream dosen‚Äôt cost 4 kroners and the local kiosk has probably been shut down. But I want to be part of creating new ways to keep golden coins, weekly pocket money and piggy banks to live on in the digital world. I want to make sure that todays children also will get that amazing feeling, that Saturdays are the greatest of days.
about.section2.content: Children are one third of our population and all of our future. Here at Gimi are children therefore obviously at the center. Not only in the use of the app, but also in the creation. The Micro Managers is our own group of experts who discuss, evaluate, and share ideas so that Gimi can become as good as possible. Would you like to get in touch with the Micro Managers, feel free to e-mail them at micromanagers@gimitheapp.com.
about.section5: Helping children and youths is important and something we take very serious. That is why we are not only educating young people in handling their own money. We are every month supporting ‚ÄùThe children's cancer fund‚Äù with parts of our employees salaries. By doing that we hope that we will help ‚ÄùThe children's cancer fund‚Äù with their important work in the fight against cancer.
faq.title: FAQ
faq.q1: In which way do you use the information that is collected through the app?
faq.q1.a: We will not sell any information that we collect through Gimi. We might make some surveys in general without any personal information being touched.
faq.q2: Why do i have to write down a phone number?
faq.q2.a: The only reason that are doing that is that we use a SMS-service to connect the phones. We will never call you or your parent without any permission from you to do so.
faq.q3: At which platforms can you find Gimi?
faq.q3.a: You can find it at App Store and Google Play. It‚Äôs able for both iPhones and Androide phones.
faq.q4.a: Nope, it is free of charge üôÇ
faq.q5: Do you send real money with Gimi?
faq.q5.a: No, today we do not have that feature. Money will be handed out by the parent, often cash or by mobile banking. Gimi is mainly developed to teach children about money, how to understand, handle and keep control over their weekly- or monthly pocket money. We are looking into how we in the future can create a service with real transfers.
faq.q6: How will information about a child be used?
faq.q6.a: We understand that your childrens information is sensitive. That is why we will never sell or use those tasks to contact the children.
faq.q7: Will pictures taken as picture proof be saved at your hard drive?
faq.q7.a: No, the pictures are sent in by a server and will only be saved locally at your phones.
faq.q8: Is it possible to create tasks that is given out every day?
faq.q8.a: Yes, if you create a new task you are able to announce which days the tasks will repet themselves.
faq.q9: How do i add an extra parent?
faq.q9.a: As a parent you can press the three lines in the top right corner when you are checking out your childs profile and later choose ‚ÄúConnect to another parent‚Äù.
faq.q10: How do i connect Gimi with my child?
faq.q10.a: Press connect together with *Name* or go to the three lines in the top right corner and press ‚ÄúInvite child‚Äù where you later can invite through a phone number or by mail, if your child don‚Äôt own any phone.
faq.q11: Why do i have a negative balance in my weekly pocket money?
faq.q11.a: You have probably made a excessive withdrawal from the weekly- or monthly pocket money, or you have reduced the weekly- or monthly pocket money to much. You can make a deposit to the piggy bank and later transfer money to the weekly- or monthly pocket money or possibly raise the amount to restore the account balance.
faq.q12: I wrote that i am a child/parent but that is wrong, what do i do?
faq.q12.a: Go to the overview and press the three lines in the top right corner. There you can log out or erase your account. If you‚Äôre a child and can‚Äôt get any further: Mail us and we will fix it.
faq.q13: Why should we set an interest rate?
faq.q13.a: An interest rate will encourage the child to save their money instead of spending them. It is also a reflection to how the grown-up lifestyle.
faq.q14: What should i put as interest rate?
faq.q14.a: It is individually, but Gimi has an average interest rate at 1,5 %. Many have more than that.
faq.q15: When is it suiteble to start using Gimi?
faq.q15.a: You as a parent will decide that, but we have designed the app so that a 6 year old child can understand it. A fine trick is to start use it togheter, children and parents.
faq.q16: At what age is my child supposed to get monthly pocket money?
faq.q16.a: Depends on different matters. What age has the child and how mature is it? Most children gets monthly pocket money in their early teenages, 12-13 years old.
faq.q17: Is Gimi connected to any bank?
faq.q17.a: No, Gimi is independent from all banks.
faq.q18: We are separated and has got the child biweekly, how do we do?
faq.q18.a: We are looking for different solutions to our next update. During that time you can pay half the amount of the weekly pocket money, and pay out money those weeks that you have the responsibility for your child. For example. Emma is supposed to get 100 kr as weekly pocket money. Put an 50 kr amount instead so that it will be right next time you see eachother.
faq.q19: Does Gimi actually teach my children about money?
faq.q19.a: Yes, Gimi is developed together with economists and child therapists to create a pedagogical service that makes it possible for children to understand how they should relate to money.
faq.q20: PLZ_TRANSLATE Jeg kom til √• skrive at jeg er et barn / foreldre, men det er galt, hva gj√∏r jeg?
faq.q20.a: PLZ_TRANSLATE G√• til Oversikt-skjermbildet og trykk de tre linjene i √∏vre h√∏yre hj√∏rne, der du enten kan slette kontoen, eller logge ut. Hvis du er et barn, og vil ogs√• vennligst mail oss og vi vil fikse det.
faq.q21: PLZ_TRANSLATE Hvordan kobler lommepenger trenger til barnet mitt?
faq.q21.a: PLZ_TRANSLATE Trykk for √• pare med * Navn * eller bes√∏ke de tre barene i √∏vre h√∏yre hj√∏rne og trykk Inviter barn, hvor du kan deretter velge √• invitere via telefon eller per post hvis barnet ikke har en telefon.
faq.q22: PLZ_TRANSLATE Hvordan legger jeg til en forelder?
faq.q22.a: PLZ_TRANSLATE Som forelder, kan du trykke p√• de tre streker √∏verst i h√∏yre hj√∏rne n√•r du er i barnets profil, og deretter velge √• flette inn en av foreldrene.
faq.q23: PLZ_TRANSLATE Kan du lage oppgaver delt ut hver dag?
faq.q23.a: PLZ_TRANSLATE Ja, n√•r du oppretter en ny oppgave, trykker du i de dager at en oppgave skal gjenta seg.
faq.q24: PLZ_TRANSLATE Lagrede bilder tatt for fotografiske bevis for deg?
faq.q24.a: PLZ_TRANSLATE Nei, bildene som sendes av en server og lagres kun lokalt p√• telefonen.
faq.q25.a: PLZ_TRANSLATE Vi forst√•r at barnas informasjon er sv√¶rt f√∏lsom, slik at vi aldri vil selge eller bruke denne informasjonen til √• kontakte barna.
faq.q26: PLZ_TRANSLATE For √• sende penger i lommepenger?
faq.q26.a: PLZ_TRANSLATE Nei, i dag har vi ikke fungere uten penger tildelt seg selv ut av den overordnede, vanligvis i kontanter eller via en mobilbank. Ukentlig kvote er utviklet prim√¶rt for √• l√¶re barn √• forst√• penger og holde p√• en ukentlig eller m√•nedlig kvote. Men vi ser p√• hvordan vi kan skape en tjeneste med reelle overf√∏ringer kommer.
faq.q28: PLZ_TRANSLATE For hvilke plattformer er ukentlig kvote?
faq.q28.a: PLZ_TRANSLATE Den er tilgjengelig p√• App Store og Google Play, og for b√•de iPhone og Android-telefoner.
footer.cookie_warning: PLZ_TRANSLATE Vi bruker informasjonskapsler for √• sikre at vi gir deg den beste opplevelsen p√• nettstedet v√•rt. Ved √• g√• videre til neste side eller klikke p√• "Jeg godtar" aksepterer du bruken av informasjonskapsler. Les mer om bruken av informasjonskapsler her:
